DOC.brief_summary: The BHCK study develop , implement , evaluate community-based obesity prevention program , operate multiple level urban food system ( policy , wholesaler , corner store , carryout , household , individual ; Baltimore , MD ) , improve healthy food supply chain increase affordability , availability , purchase consumption healthy food within low-income , minority neighborhood .
DOC.detailed_description: Our overarch goal develop evaluate community-based obesity prevention program , operate multiple level urban food system ( policy , wholesaler , corner store , carryout , household , individual ; Baltimore , MD ) , improve healthy food supply chain increase affordability , availability , purchase consumption healthy food within low-income minority neighborhood . Our research include stakeholders/ partner different level , e.g. , policy , wholesaler , retailer , adult caregiver , individual child level , develop , implement , assess two year multi-level systems-based child obesity prevention strategy target minority low-income child ( predominantly AA ) . Thirty low-income , predominantly AA geographic zone identify ( `` healthy eating zone '' ) . Half zone randomize intervention , half control . Within intervention zone work 3-5 small food store prepare food source increase access healthy food wholesaler discount , display point purchase promotional material , provide nutrition food preparation education target youth caregiver . We work local policymakers institutionalize sustain change . The project evaluate impact program : ) healthy food pricing availability , b ) low income African American adult food purchase preparation , c ) low-income African American youth diet , associate psychosocial factor .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Child participant : 914 year age Living within one intervention neighborhood Family anticipate move outside study area duration intervention Inclusion Criteria Adult Caregiver participant : Parent/ legal guardian child age 914 year age Living within one intervention neighborhood Family anticipate move outside study area duration intervention Exclusion criterion : Families child within age range Families live within neighborhood study area Families move outside study area within intervention timeframe
